objects.name: Granite Taurus
objects.description: Granite Taurus aka menuPass, is a threat group whose members the US Department of Justice state operate from China as employees of the Tianjin-based Huaying Haitai Science and Technology Development Company in coordination with the Ministry of State Security's Tianjin State Security Bureau. The group has been active since approximately 2006 and has targeted healthcare, defense, aerospace, and government sectors around the world, and has targeted Japanese victims since at least 2014. In 2016 and 2017, the group targeted managed IT service providers, manufacturing and mining companies, and a university.

objects.name: September - November 2016
objects.description:
In 2016, from September through November, Granite Taurus targeted Japanese academics working in several areas of science, along with Japanese pharmaceutical and a US-based subsidiary of a Japanese manufacturing organization. 

The attackers spoofed several sender email addresses to send spear-phishing emails, most notably public addresses associated with the Sasakawa Peace Foundation and The White House. All the spear phishes were socially engineered with subjects appropriate for the target and the apparent sender.

objects.name: ChChes
objects.description:
A malware commonly signed using a since-revoked Hacking Team digital signature.
The malware's communication utilises the HTTP Cookie field to transmit data, and the malware is capable of installing additional modules.

objects.name: ChChes
objects.description:
A malware commonly signed using a since-revoked Hacking Team digital signature.
The malware's communication utilises the HTTP Cookie field to transmit data, and the malware is capable of installing additional modules.
Sample was digitally signed using a expired certificade originally used by HackingTeam
C2 server communicates over HTTP and embeds data within the Cookie HTTP header.

Sample was digitally signed using a expired certificate originally used by HackingTeam .
